citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
During document review, an incident was noted in the IACUC meeting minutes dated June 27, 2024 in which a veterinary
directive was given to separate one colony housed marmoset from its cage mates. The directive stated that the animal
was to be placed in a transport box located outside of its home cage to ensure both physical and visual separation. When
the animal was checked by the veterinarians the next morning, they observed the animal still had visual contact with its
cage-mates and was exhibiting signs of distress which were alleviated as soon as a visual barrier was placed. Retraining
and additional veterinary oversight have been provided for this Investigator and these animals. Veterinary instructions
need to be followed as directed to ensure animal well-being and to avoid inadvertent and unnecessary discomfort,
physical harm, trauma and behavioral stress. Each facility shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate
authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care
and use.
Corrected prior to inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.33(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
During document review, an incident was noted in the IACUC meeting minutes dated June 27, 2024 in which a veterinary 
directive was given to separate one colony housed marmoset from its cage mates. The directive stated that the animal 
was to be placed in a transport box located outside of its home cage to ensure both physical and visual separation. When 
the animal was checked by the veterinarians the next morning, they observed the animal still had visual contact with its 
cage-mates and was exhibiting signs of distress which were alleviated as soon as a visual barrier was placed. Retraining 
and additional veterinary oversight have been provided for this Investigator and these animals. Veterinary instructions 
need to be followed as directed to ensure animal well-being and to avoid inadvertent and unnecessary discomfort, 
physical harm, trauma and behavioral stress. Each facility shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate 
authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care 
and use. 
Corrected prior to inspection 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
